meanings.definition: To improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
meanings.sent1: She spent hours refining her essay to make it better.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler is refining the gold to make it shine brightly.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was refining his dance moves to impress his cat.
meanings.sent4: Her skills in refining the art of negotiation were unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The artist was refining the details of the painting with great care.

meanings.definition: To reduce to a pure state; purify
meanings.sent1: The process of refining sugar involves removing impurities.
meanings.sent2: They are refining the oil to make it suitable for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could refine any metal into gold.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a refining fire, burning away falsehoods.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was refining the water to make it safe for drinking.

meanings.definition: To make more fine, subtle, or precise
meanings.sent1: The artist is refining the details of the portrait to capture the subject's essence.
meanings.sent2: By refining his speech, he became a more effective communicator.
meanings.sent3: The chef was refining the recipe to create the perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: Her refined taste in music made her a sought-after DJ.
meanings.sent5: The writer spent hours refining each sentence to create a masterpiece.
